info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 7:21PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Virga showers and isolated thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Teller and northwestern El Paso Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 719 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of virga showers and isolated thunderstorms along a line extending from near Monument to 6 miles west of Stratmoor. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts to 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Air Force Academy around 725 PM MDT. Colorado Springs, Fort Carson, Gleneagle and Stratmoor around 730 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Security, Security-Widefield, Fountain, Black Forest and Peterson AFB. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
